Description: Lid sherd of Chian black-figured Sphinx and Lion Style pottery stemmed bowl; white slip; interior reserved; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of lion and perhaps siren to right (mouth and part of mane of lion remaining; added red on mane; of siren tail feathers with added red); incised rising and full rosettes with red centres as filling ornament; below, trace of lines.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Lemos places this sherd in Stage 1 of Group D of the Sphinx and Lion Style. Although the imagery is lively, the execution of the figures is loose and careless. The rosette on vases of Stage 1 appears clumsy.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 148, p. 315, no. 1348, pl. 174)
Price 1924 / Pottery of Naukratis (pl. XII, no. 13)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.2120) (phase 2)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
